class.rdfs:comment: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the offers property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.
class.rdfs:label: Event

schema:about.rdfs:comment: The subject matter of the content.
schema:about.rdfs:label: about

schema:actor.rdfs:comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
schema:actor.rdfs:label: actor

schema:aggregateRating.rdfs:comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.
schema:aggregateRating.rdfs:label: aggregateRating

schema:attendee.rdfs:comment: A person or organization attending the event.
schema:attendee.rdfs:label: attendee

schema:audience.rdfs:comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.
schema:audience.rdfs:label: audience

schema:composer.rdfs:comment: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.
schema:composer.rdfs:label: composer

schema:contributor.rdfs:comment: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.
schema:contributor.rdfs:label: contributor

schema:director.rdfs:comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
schema:director.rdfs:label: director

schema:duration.rdfs:comment: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.
schema:duration.rdfs:label: duration

schema:endDate.rdfs:comment: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
schema:endDate.rdfs:label: endDate

schema:eventStatus.rdfs:comment: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.
schema:eventStatus.rdfs:label: eventStatus

schema:funder.rdfs:comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.
schema:funder.rdfs:label: funder

schema:inLanguage.rdfs:comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.
schema:inLanguage.rdfs:label: inLanguage

schema:isAccessibleForFree.rdfs:comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.
schema:isAccessibleForFree.rdfs:label: isAccessibleForFree

schema:location.rdfs:comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.
schema:location.rdfs:label: location

schema:maximumAttendeeCapacity.rdfs:comment: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.
schema:maximumAttendeeCapacity.rdfs:label: maximumAttendeeCapacity

schema:offers.rdfs:comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.
schema:offers.rdfs:label: offers

schema:performer.rdfs:comment: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.
schema:performer.rdfs:label: performer

schema:performers.rdfs:comment: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.
schema:performers.rdfs:label: performers

schema:previousStartDate.rdfs:comment: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.
schema:previousStartDate.rdfs:label: previousStartDate

schema:recordedIn.rdfs:comment: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.
schema:recordedIn.rdfs:label: recordedIn

schema:remainingAttendeeCapacity.rdfs:comment: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.
schema:remainingAttendeeCapacity.rdfs:label: remainingAttendeeCapacity

schema:sponsor.rdfs:comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.
schema:sponsor.rdfs:label: sponsor

schema:startDate.rdfs:comment: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
schema:startDate.rdfs:label: startDate

schema:subEvent.rdfs:comment: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.
schema:subEvent.rdfs:label: subEvent

schema:subEvents.rdfs:comment: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.
schema:subEvents.rdfs:label: subEvents

schema:superEvent.rdfs:comment: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.
schema:superEvent.rdfs:label: superEvent

schema:translator.rdfs:comment: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.
schema:translator.rdfs:label: translator

schema:typicalAgeRange.rdfs:comment: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.
schema:typicalAgeRange.rdfs:label: typicalAgeRange

schema:workFeatured.rdfs:comment:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).
schema:workFeatured.rdfs:label: workFeatured

schema:workPerformed.rdfs:comment: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.
schema:workPerformed.rdfs:label: workPerformed
